title: What is an example of complement of set in maths? - Quora

response.answer_text: Draw a venn diagram (It is a rectangular box drawn in which we draw circle which represents a set and the whole area of shape is called universal set). Now, draw a circle. Make sure that circle remains inscribed. Now, name it as A. After this, You should know the meaning of complement. Complement of A will be called the points which aren't related to A i.e. which are not on or inside A. Now the points lying outside of A is the complement of A. We denote it by A' or sometimes A^c. Hope this helps...
